item.name: dot-config download status
item.description: Result of loading or downloading dot-config file ok - dot-config downloaded or loaded correctly downloadError - unable to download a file from a given source checkError - config file is not valid or too short (less than 200 characters). errorMinor - cannot read the status file, problem is probably somewhere else dhcpError - unable to get URL to dot-config via DHCP (only for forceDhcp)

trigger.name: boot configuration status is not ok

item.name: hwinfo readout status
item.description: Result of hwinfo readout ok - hwinfo readout successful error - hwinfo readout failed errorMinor - cannot read status file, problem is probably somewhere else warning - no hwinfo partition

item.name: Number of kernel modules missing
item.description: Checking if all desired kernel modules are loaded. allKernelModulesPresent - all modules loaded other numbers represent number of modules not loaded other errors (like unable to open /proc/modules) are reported as maximum number of missing modules

item.name: FPGA load status
item.description: Result of loading FPGA ok - FPGA loaded successfully error - loading failed errorMinor - cannot read status file, problem is probably somewhere else fileNotFound - file to be loaded not found

item.name: wrsBootSuccessful
item.description: Grouped status of wrsBootStatusGroup, indicating whether boot was successful ok - values in wrsBootStatusGroup are correct error - there is an error in wrsBootStatusGroup warning - there is a warning in wrsBootStatusGroup warningNA - there is N/A field in wrsBootStatusGroup bug - bug in checking conditions of wrsBootStatusGroup, please report

item.name: Number of userspace daemons missing
item.description: Checking if all desired daemons are running. allDaemonsPresent - all daemons running other numbers represent number of daemons not running other errors (can be: unable to run ps command or problem with multiple process instances) are reported as maximum number of missing modules

item.name: Source of used dot-config
item.description: Source of used dotconfig local - used dot-config was stored on the switch remote - dot-config retrieved from the network check the wrsConfigSourceUrl for the path tryDhcp - try to get URL to the dot-config via DHCP, if DHCP retrieve fail do not propagate error to the wrsBootSuccessful; forceDhcp - get URL to the dot-config via DHCP, if failed propagate error to the wrsBootSuccessful errorMinor - cannot read the status file, problem is probably somewhere else

trigger.name: configuration file setting is not forceDHCP

item.name: wrsCpuLoadHigh
item.description: Status of CPU load. Based on average load in group wrsCpuLoad. Error - average CPU load is more than 3 for 1min, 2 for 5min or 1.5 for 15min Warning - average CPU load is more than 2 for 1min, 1.5 for 5min or 1 for 15min

item.name: wrsDateTAI
item.description: The current time, in TAI seconds

trigger.name: wrsDateTAI zabbix sampling delay too large
trigger.description: Usually an indication of: - Zabbix poller process being too busy - TAI time jump - Time not synchronized to GPS

parameters.parameter: // subtract 0.5 due to integer input data return value - 0.5 - Date.now() / 1000;

trigger.name: TAI to zabbix local time offset > {$TAI_UTC_OFFSET_WARNING}
trigger.description: Usually an indication of: - Zabbix poller or preprocessor processes being too busy - TAI time jump - Time not synchronized to GPS

item.name: wrsDiskSpaceLow
item.description: Status of used disk space. Based on wrsDiskTable. Error - more than 90% of any disk is used Warning - more than 80% of any disk is used

item.name: wrsEndpointStatus
item.description: Grouped status of all endpoints ok - all endpoints are ok error - erro in at least one endpoint firstRead - cannot calculate value from only one read

item.name: wrsLeapSecSource
item.description: Source leap second file (leap-seconds.list) local - The local file is used tryRemote - Try to download the file, if it fails do not propagate error forceRemote - Try to download the file, if it fails the error is propagated errorMinor - cannot read the status file, problem is probably somewhere else

item.name: wrsLeapSecSourceStatusDetails
item.description: Download status of the leap seconds file ok - Everything is OK updated - Local leap seconds file has been updated dhcpError - DHCP error detected invalidUrl - The URL is not reachable or invalid invalidFile - The download file is invalid downloadError - Error detected during the download errorMinor - cannot read the status file, problem is probably somewhere else

trigger.name: Failed to download leap seconds file

item.name: wrsLeapSecStatusDetails
item.description: Leap second status ok - Everything ok leapSecFileExpired - The current leap second file is out-dated internalErrorDetected - Internal error detected (system,...) taiReadError - Cannot read the TAI time leaSecInserted - A leap second will be inserted at 00:00 leapSecDeleted - A leap second will be deleted at 00:00 errorMinor - cannot read the status file, problem is probably somewhere else

item.name: wrsMainSystemStatus
item.description: Grouped status of WRS switch ok - other objects in wrsGeneralStatusGroup are ok error - there is an error in wrsGeneralStatusGroup warning - there is a warning in wrsGeneralStatusGroup warningNA - there is N/A field in wrsGeneralStatusGroup bug - bug in checking conditions of wrsGeneralStatusGroup, please report

item.name: wrsMemoryFreeLow
item.description: Status of free memory. Based on wrsMemoryGroup. Error - more than 80% memory used Warning - more than 50% memory used

item.name: wrsNetworkingStatus
item.description: Grouped status of wrsNetworkingStatusGroup ok - values in wrsNetworkingStatusGroup are ok error - there is an error in wrsNetworkingStatusGroup warning - there is a warning in wrsNetworkingStatusGroup warningNA - there is N/A field in wrsNetworkingStatusGroup bug - bug in checking conditions of wrsNetworkingStatusGroup, please report

item.name: wrsOSStatus
item.description: Grouped status of wrsOSStatusGroup ok - values in wrsOSStatusGroup are ok error - there is an error in wrsOSStatusGroup warning - there is a warning in wrsOSStatusGroup warningNA - there is N/A field in wrsOSStatusGroup bug - bug in checking conditions of wrsOSStatusGroup, please report

item.name: wrsPtpClockOffsetErrCnt
item.description: Number of servo updates with wrong clock offset

item.name: wrsPtpClockOffsetPs
item.description: Current clock offset from master in picoseconds

item.name: wrsPtpClockOffsetPsHR
item.description: Human Readable current clock offset from master, in picoseconds with saturation to integer

item.name: wrsPTPFramesFlowing
item.description: Grouped status of TX and RX PTP packets flowing ok - when there are PTP packets flowing in both directions on all wr ports that are up warningNA - there is N/A in one of object used to calculate this value error - no PTP packets flowing on at least one wr up port firstRead - cannot calculate value from only one read

item.name: wrsPtpGrandmasterID
item.description: The ClockID of the current grandmaster

item.name: wrsPtpLinkLength
item.description: Estimated fiber length, from master-to-slave delay, in meters

item.name: wrsPtpMode
item.description: The mode of this clock

item.name: wrsPtpOwnID
item.description: The ClockID of this WR device

item.name: wrsPtpPhaseTracking
item.description: Whether phase tracking is enabled in the servo

item.name: wrsPtpPortName
item.description: Port name on which servo instance is running

item.name: PTP Round-Trip Time
item.description: The round-trip-time, from master, in picoseconds

item.name: wrsPtpRTTErrCnt
item.description: Number of servo updates with wrong RTT

item.name: wrsPtpServoStateErrCnt
item.description: Number of servo updates with wrong servo state

item.name: wrsPtpServoStateN
item.description: Numeric representation of servo state

item.name: wrsPtpServoUpdates
item.description: How many time did the servo run

item.name: PTP Skew
item.description: The estimated change of master-to-slave delay, in picoseconds

item.name: wrsPTPStatus
item.description: Grouped status of PTP daemon based on values in wrsPtpDataTable ok - Correct values in wrsPtpDataTable error - error in wrsPtpDataTable firstRead - unable to calculate deltas in first read

item.name: wrsPtpSyncSource
item.description: The port name that is currently the synchronization source

item.name: Reason of last switch restart
item.description: Reason of last switch restart. error(1) - unable to read restart reason or reset counters generalReset(2) - Both VDDCORE and VDDBU rising (power-on) wakeUpReset(3) - VDDCORE rising watchdogReset(4) - Watchdog fault occurred softwareReset(5) - Processor reset required by the software (system reboot) userReset(6) - NRST pin detected low (reset button) restartByMonit(7) - Restart caused by Monit, please check wrsRestartReasonMonit for program that caused problems

item.name: wrsRestartReasonMonit
item.description: Program's name which caused the monit to restart the switch due to too many crashes

item.name: wrsRTUStatus
item.description: RTU status ok - correct RTU status error - erroneous RTU status firstRead - cannot calculate value from only one read

item.name: wrsSFPsStatus
item.description: Grouped status of SFPs ok - all SFPs are ok error - there is an error in SFP warningNA - there is N/A in one of object used to calculate this value bug - bug in checking conditions of SFPs, please report

item.name: wrsSlaveLinksStatus
item.description: Grouped status of slave link statuses ok - all links have proper status error - wrong link status of at least one link warningNA - there is N/A in one of object used to calculate this value

trigger.name: WR Slave Links Status not Ok

item.name: wrsSwcoreStatus
item.description: Overall status of Soft Core. ok - correct Soft Core status error - erroneous Soft Core status firstRead - cannot calculate value from only one read

item.name: wrsSystemClockDriftUs
item.description: Drift of system clock expressed in microseconds with saturation to min/max integer values

item.name: wrsSystemClockStatus
item.description: Grouped status of system clock ok - system clock is withing threshold (set in WRS configuration) to NTP time and correct leap seconds file was loaded error - system clock problem, either it diverged or incorrect leap seconds file is used warning - leapseconds file is not valid anymore and should be updated warningNA - some information could not be retrieved to calculate the value of this object

trigger.name: WR System Clock Status not Ok

item.name: wrsSystemClockStatusDetails
item.description: The system clock is compared to NTP time ok - system clock is under the threshold value thresholdExceeded - system clock has exceeded the threshold value IOError - IO error detected (error) unknownStatus - Unexpected status (error) error - Error detected warningNA - there is N/A in one of object used to calculate this value

trigger.name: WR System Clock Status not Ok

item.name: wrsTemperatureWarning
item.description: Warning if temperature exceed threshold levels

item.name: wrsTimingStatus
item.description: Grouped status of wrsTimingStatusGroup ok - values in wrsTimingStatusGroup are ok error - there is an error in wrsTimingStatusGroup warning - there is a warning in wrsTimingStatusGroup warningNA - there is N/A field in wrsTimingStatusGroup bug - bug in checking conditions of wrsTimingStatusGroup, please report

item.name: wrsVersionBackplaneVersion
item.description: The hardware version of minibackplane PCB

item.name: wrsVersionGwBuild
item.description: The build ID of gateware (FPGA bitstream)

item.name: wrsVersionGwVersion
item.description: The version of gateware (FPGA bitstream)

item.name: wrsVersionSwitchSerialNumber
item.description: The serial number (or string) of the switch

item.name: wrsVersionSwVersion
item.description: The software version, as returned from 'git describe' at build time

item.name: Result of setting up VLANs
item.description: Result of setting up VLANs ok - successful set up of VLANs failed - error while setting up VLANs disabled - the setting up of VLANs disabled in dot-config error - unsuported status errorMinor - cannot read the status file, the problem is probably somewhere else

item_prototype.name: $1 link state
item_prototype.description: Whether the link is up or down

item_prototype.name: $1 peer locked
item_prototype.description: Whether the peers are locked or not

item_prototype.name: $1 PTP RX frames
item_prototype.description: Number of received PTP frames per port (for all PPSI instances running on particular port

item_prototype.name: $1 PTP TX frames
item_prototype.description: Number of transmitted PTP frames per port (for all PPSI instances running on particular port

item_prototype.name: $1 SFP error
item_prototype.description: Problem with SFP configuration. Port has to be always 1GbE. Port has to be in data base as long as support WR.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} SFP Error
trigger_prototype.description: Problem with SFP configuration. Port has to be always 1GbE. Port has to be in data base as long as support WR.

item_prototype.name: $1 SFP in database
item_prototype.description: Whether the SFP is in data base or not

macro.description: current TAI offset from leap_seconds.list file
warn when TAI offset exceeds this many seconds

value.name: PTP master to slave delay change

graph.name: PTP master to slave delay change
